overview_summary: All four profiled neighbors have an **unknown stance** toward the development, as none have made public statements for or against it. Their community influence ranges from mostly **low** to an isolated **medium**: one neighbor (a local financial advisor and entrepreneur) holds moderate influence, while the rest have limited public profiles or leadership roles.

neighbors.name: Clayton D. Cordell Jr. & Alayssa L. Cordell
neighbors.claims: Clayton D. “Doug” Cordell Jr. was a U.S. Army veteran (honorably discharged in 1976) who passed away at age 67 in February 2024[Clayton Cordell Obituary (2024) - Marion, IN - Chronicle-Tribune](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/chronicle-tribune/name/clayton-cordell-obituary?id=54378065). He and Alayssa L. Cordell were listed as co-owners of a Putnam County parcel, and no public record of their participation in local civic meetings or debates on development was found[Putnam County Government, Indiana](https://www.putnamcounty67.us/cgi.exe?CALL_PROGRAM=MINUTES&PAGEID=0010).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage privately through family or local contacts, acknowledging the family’s tenure and respectfully listening to any concerns about land use.

neighbors.name: Johnnie L. Chestnut
neighbors.claims: Johnnie L. Chestnut is a certified financial planner (AIF®, CFP®) who owns and operates Chestnut Financial Group in Cloverdale, Indiana[Johnnie Lee Chestnut | AdvisorCheck](https://www.advisorcheck.com/advisor/3262183-johnnie-lee-chestnut-osaic-advisory-services-llc-cloverdale-indiana). He has multiple business ventures, including a candle-making enterprise and a partnership in a local golf course, indicating an active entrepreneurial presence in the community[Johnnie Lee Chestnut | AdvisorCheck](https://www.advisorcheck.com/advisor/3262183-johnnie-lee-chestnut-osaic-advisory-services-llc-cloverdale-indiana). No public statements by Chestnut about land development or energy projects have been documented in local news or official records.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach via professional networks or community business circles. Emphasize the project’s economic benefits and address any financial or property value questions he may raise.

neighbors.name: Tyler K. Lotz & Jessica P. Winders
neighbors.claims: Tyler K. Lotz and Jessica P. Winders are co-owners of a Putnam County property, but they do not appear in local news reports or public civic records[Putnam County Government, Indiana](https://www.putnamcounty67.us/cgi.exe?CALL_PROGRAM=MINUTES&PAGEID=0010). There is no indication of either holding any prominent community positions or voicing opinions on development issues in the area.

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out in a neighborly way (e.g., door-to-door visit or community meeting invite) to introduce the project and hear any personal concerns about their home or neighborhood.

neighbors.name: Tyson D. Hillenburg & Jillianne N. Hillenburg
neighbors.claims: Tyson D. Hillenburg and Jillianne N. Hillenburg own land in Putnam County, but have maintained a low public profile. Their names do not surface in county board minutes or local news archives, suggesting they have not taken a visible role in community debates[Putnam County Government, Indiana](https://www.putnamcounty67.us/cgi.exe?CALL_PROGRAM=MINUTES&PAGEID=0010). No public stance or statements regarding development or renewable energy projects could be identified.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach via a trusted community member (such as an agriculture extension or local farmer liaison) to discuss the project. Emphasize respect for their land and address practical issues like land management and infrastructure early.
